title: cafter
author: cafter
content: how can i delete my own thread?

comments.author: TryNinja
comments.body: You can’t, but if you edit the topic content to “delete please” and report it yourself with a note that you want it deleted, maybe a mod will do it.

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: You can't, unless someone report it then mods do the work. You can just move it to archive board and delete the content including the title. If there are replies already, well, you can't do about that.

comments.author: BlackBoss_
comments.body: Quote from: cafter on July 25, 2023, 11:08:09 AMhow can i delete my own thread?You can not. You can delete your posts but can not delete your threads / topics. You only can lock your thread, move it to Archival or send a report to moderator and hope that they will delete the thread for you.Just don't create threads so you won't have to delete them.I search for answers from moderators in that thread but mprep will need to correct this Q&A.Quote from: mprep on July 21, 2014, 05:27:51 PMQ: How do I delete/lock my own thread(s) when I no longer need them?A: On the top right of your post is a delete button. You can delete threads if nobody has seen them. Otherwise, just click "Lock topic" link at the bottom left.

comments.author: _act_
comments.body: I will advice OP to lock this thread to avoid same answers. When all valid information have been posted already, cafterlock this thread.
